page.title: 11A FORESTERS DAY
page.content:
{ Trees}destroyed by fire, Squirrels, Deers and Hares.
A{FORESTER'S}DAY. Mr Peter Pearson gets up at 7 o'clock am and leaves Newcastleton Office at 7.20 am.He travels to{Dykecrofts workshop then leaves{Dykecrofts}to go to Tinisburn. He gets to Tinisburn at 8.00 am.He starts{felling trees}at 8.10 am till 12.00.At work he {fells,}sneds and cuts{trees.}He must stop 10 minutes every hour because he might develop{"chainsaw}shake"(from vibrations off the{saw})- or white finger in winter when cold stops circulation. He also wears protective clothing a helmet,earmuffs,visor and steel capped boots.Then he stops for lunch at 12.00 am till 12.30 pm.He starts{felling}again at 12.35 and works through till 3.20 pm.
